description: Tables used by Azure Monitor for Containers.

tables.name: AKSAudit
tables.description: Contains all Kubernetes API Server audit logs including events with the get and list verbs. These events are useful for monitoring all of the interactions with the Kubernetes API. To limit the scope to modifying operations see the AKSAuditAdmin table. Requires Diagnostic Settings to use the Resource Specific destination table.

columns.name: TimeGenerated
columns.description: Event generation time.

columns.name: Level
columns.description: Level (Metadata, Request, RequestResponse) of the audit event.

columns.name: AuditId
columns.description: Unique audit ID that is generated for each request.

columns.name: Stage
columns.description: The request handling stage (RequestReceived, ResponseStarted, ResponseComplete, Panic) at which this audit event was generated.

columns.name: RequestUri
columns.description: The URI of the request made by the client to the server.

columns.name: Verb
columns.description: The Kubernetes verb associated with the request. For non-resource requests, this is the lower-cased HTTP method.

columns.name: User
columns.description: Authenticated user metadata of the requesting client, including optional fields such as UID and groups.

columns.name: SourceIps
columns.description: The list of source IP addresses for the originating client and intermediate proxies.

columns.name: UserAgent
columns.description: The user agent string presented by the originating client.

columns.name: ObjectRef
columns.description: The Kubernetes object reference this event was targeted for. This field does not apply for list requests nor non-resource requests.

columns.name: ResponseStatus
columns.description: Response status for the request, which includes the response code. In error cases, this object will include the error message property.

columns.name: RequestObject
columns.description: Kubernetes API object from the request in object format or the string "skipped-too-big-size-object". This is omitted for non-resource requests.

columns.name: ResponseObject
columns.description: Kubernetes API object from the response, in object format or the string "skipped-too-big-size-object". This is omitted for non-resource requests.

columns.name: RequestReceivedTime
columns.description: Time when the API Server first received the request.

columns.name: StageReceivedTime
columns.description: Time when the request reached the current audit stage.

columns.name: Annotations
columns.description: An unstructed key-value map associated with this audit event. These annotations are set by plugins as part of the request serving chain and are included at the Metadata event level.

columns.name: PodName
columns.description: Name of the pod emitting this audit event.

tables.name: AKSAuditAdmin
tables.description: Contains Kubernetes API Server audit logs excluding events with the get and list verbs. These events are useful for monitoring resource modification requests made to the Kubernetes API. To see all modifying and non-modifying operations see the AKSAudit table. Requires Diagnostic Settings to use the Resource Specific destination table.

columns.name: TimeGenerated
columns.description: Event generation time.

columns.name: Level
columns.description: Level (Metadata, Request, RequestResponse) of the audit event.

columns.name: AuditId
columns.description: Unique audit ID that is generated for each request.

columns.name: Stage
columns.description: The request handling stage (RequestReceived, ResponseStarted, ResponseComplete, Panic) at which this audit event was generated.

columns.name: RequestUri
columns.description: The URI of the request made by the client to the server.

columns.name: Verb
columns.description: The Kubernetes verb associated with the request. For non-resource requests, this is the lower-cased HTTP method.

columns.name: User
columns.description: Authenticated user metadata of the requesting client, including optional fields such as UID and groups.

columns.name: SourceIps
columns.description: The list of source IP addresses for the originating client and intermediate proxies.

columns.name: UserAgent
columns.description: The user agent string presented by the originating client.

columns.name: ObjectRef
columns.description: The Kubernetes object reference this event was targeted for. This field does not apply for list requests nor non-resource requests.

columns.name: ResponseStatus
columns.description: Response status for the request, which includes the response code. In error cases, this object will include the error message property.

columns.name: RequestObject
columns.description: Kubernetes API object from the request in object format or the string "skipped-too-big-size-object". This is omitted for non-resource requests.

columns.name: ResponseObject
columns.description: Kubernetes API object from the response, in object format or the string "skipped-too-big-size-object". This is omitted for non-resource requests.

columns.name: RequestReceivedTime
columns.description: Time when the API Server first received the request.

columns.name: StageReceivedTime
columns.description: Time when the request reached the current audit stage.

columns.name: Annotations
columns.description: An unstructed key-value map associated with this audit event. These annotations are set by plugins as part of the request serving chain and are included at the Metadata event level.

columns.name: PodName
columns.description: Name of the pod emitting this audit event.

tables.description: Contains diagnostic logs for the Kubernetes API Server, Controller Manager, Scheduler, Cluster Autoscaler, Cloud Controller Manager, Guard, the Azure CSI storage drivers, Azure Fleet Manager agents and Karpenter controller logs. These diagnostic logs have distinct Category entries corresponding their diagnostic log setting (e.g. kube-apiserver, kube-audit-admin). Requires Diagnostic Settings to use the Resource Specific destination table.

columns.name: TimeGenerated
columns.description: Event generation time.

columns.name: Category
columns.description: Service log category describing the service logging the message.

columns.name: Level
columns.description: Level (Fatal, Error, Warning, Info) of the log message.

columns.name: Message
columns.description: Log message body.

columns.name: Stream
columns.description: Output stream (stdout, stderr) source of the log message.

columns.name: PodName
columns.description: Name of the pod logging the request.

tables.description: Contains diagnostic logs for Karpenter, the Kubernetes autoscaling component. These logs include information about node provisioning, deprovisioning, and scaling decisions.

columns.name: TimeGenerated
columns.description: Event generation time.

columns.name: Category
columns.description: Service log category describing the service logging the message.

columns.name: Level
columns.description: Level (Fatal, Error, Warning, Info, Debug) of the log message.

columns.name: Message
columns.description: Log message body.

columns.name: Stream
columns.description: Output stream (stdout, stderr) source of the log message.

columns.name: PodName
columns.description: Name of the pod emitting this audit event.

queries.displayName: Volume of Kubernetes audit events per SourceIp
queries.description: Display the count of Kubernetes audit events generated from a given source IP address for each AKS cluster. Requires Diagnostic Settings to use the Resource Specific destination table.

queries.displayName: Volume of admin Kubernetes audit events per username
queries.description: Display the count of admin Kubernetes audit events generated from a given user name for each AKS cluster. Requires Diagnostic Settings to use the Resource Specific destination table.

queries.displayName: Admin Kubernetes audit events for deployment
queries.description: Query for admin Kubernetes audit events against deployments within the default namespace. Requires Diagnostic Settings to use the Resource Specific destination table.
Query for logs from the cluster autoscaler. This can help explain why the cluster is unexpectedly scaling up or down. Requires Diagnostic Settings to use the Resource Specific destination table.
Query for logs from the Kubernetes API server. Requires Diagnostic Settings to use the Resource Specific destination table.
